business.headline: Sensex, Nifty rebound amid cautious optimism ahead of RBI meetThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 445.29 points to close at 80,248.08, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 144.95 points to end at 24,276.05.

Government scraps windfall tax on crude oil, jet fuel, petrol and diesel exportsFirst imposed in July 2022, the windfall tax—formally known as Special Additional Excise Duty (SAED)—was introduced to capitalise on extraordinary profits earned by oil producers and exporters amid surging global crude prices driven by the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

PAN 2.0 FAQs: Who can apply, QR code feature, and other key detailsPAN 2.0 is a government initiative combining PAN and TAN systems with a QR code for secure and quick identity verification, simplifying taxpayer registration and promoting a tech-driven tax ecosystem.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: India condemns breach at Bangladesh mission in Agartala during protest rallyThe statement from the Ministry of External Affairs came hours after over 50 people, who were protesting against attacks on Hindus in Bangladesh, allegedly entered the premises of the Bangladeshi mission in Agartala on Monday.

PM, Vikrant Massey watch The Sabarmati Report, actor says 'high point of career'Last month, Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised The Sabarmati Report filmmakers for "revealing the truth" behind the 2002 Godhra train burning incident and said a "fake narrative can only persist for a limited period of time".

Sukhbir Badal to clean Gurdwara washrooms, kitchens for 'religious misconduct'The Akal Takht directed Sukhbir Badal to clean washrooms at the Golden Temple after he was pronounced guilty for religious misconduct, including pardoning Dera chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim in 2015.

'Indians are crazy': Woman put on no-fly list after racist attack at LA airportAn American woman was placed on United Airlines' no-fly list after hurling racist slurs at celebrated wedding photographer Pervez Taufiq and his Indian-American family on a shuttle bus at the Los Angeles International Airport.

Man cheats 500 single people using fake matrimonial sites: Modus operandi revealedThe fake matrimonial websites were promoted on social media platforms such as Facebook and Instagram, using photos of women downloaded from the internet to fabricate enticing profiles.

Ruling BJP legislators Babu Singh and Sanatan Bijuli strongly condemned the incident in the Odisha assembly, calling for strict action against the perpetrators.

What led farmers to pause protest at Delhi-Noida borderThe protesting farmers in Noida have temporarily paused their 'Delhi Chalo' march after holding talks with government officials. The farmers have been assured of a meeting with the Uttar Pradesh Chief Secretary within a week for their demands.

Canada scrapping SDS visa to benefit Indian students, says India. Here's whyCanada has ended its Student Direct Stream (SDS) visa programme, which allowed Indian students to fast-track their study permit applications. Antibiotic breakthrough from India can counter drug-resistant bacteriaIndia has introduced its first indigenous antibiotic, Nafithromycin, targeting drug-resistant pneumonia. The drug is 10 times more efficacious and provides eight times higher lung exposure than azithromycin.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.
